page.title: 17BRANSTON'S POPULATION
page.content: In 1961 the national census told us the population of Branston was 2,O38.In 1971 census figures for Branston told us the population had increased to 2,519. In 1981 the census figures told us the population had increased to 3,211. This means the population has increased by about 1,2OO in 2O years.We obtained the population estimates for 1982 and 1983 from the county council. These showed that the population could go up by 150 by 1983,to 3,349. This means that by 1985 the population of Branston would be nealy 3,500 people, an increase of 72% since 1961. After the war lots of building started. Three new estates are now finshed because more people have come to live in Branston.
